title: Longest Subarray with at Most K Distinct Digits
description: Given a non-negative integer array `nums` and an integer `k`, find the length of the longest subarray where each number contains at most `k` distinct digits.  A number's distinct digits are the unique digits it contains. For example, the number 123 has 3 distinct digits, while 112 has 2.

examples.explanation: The longest subarray satisfying the condition is [12, 123, 45].  Each number in this subarray has at most 2 distinct digits. [11,222] also has at most 2 distinct digits in each but the length is 2 which is smaller than 3
The longest subarray is [56, 7].  Numbers with 3 or less distinct digits

The longest subarray is any single element subarray because they all contain at most 1 unique digit.

Constraints:
- 1 <= len(nums) <= 1000
- 0 <= nums[i] <= 10^9  (nums[i] can be very large numbers)
- 1 <= k <= 10
- Time complexity should be O(n), where n is the length of nums.
- Space complexity should be O(1) (Hint: consider a count of distinct digits, not storing all the digits).
